original_data.question: A 32-year-old woman comes to the physician because of fatigue and joint pain for the past 4 months. Examination shows erythema with scaling on both cheeks that spares the nasolabial folds and two 1-cm ulcers in the oral cavity. Further evaluation of this patient is most likely to show which of the following findings?

model_response:
The findings are those of Sjogren syndrome, an autoimmune disease characterized by lymphocytic infiltration of the salivary and lacrimal glands, leading to xerostomia and xerophthalmia. The disease is associated with autoimmune disorders, including systemic lupus erythematosus, rheumatoid arthritis, scleroderma, and Sjogren syndrome. The initial laboratory findings are those of a nonspecific inflammatory response, with leukopenia, lymphopenia, and an increase in the erythrocyte sedimentation rate. Later, the patient may develop a lymphoproliferative disorder, with increased levels of IgA and IgG and a positive test for rheumatoid factor.

Answer: OPTION A IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: The state of weariness following a period of exertion, mental or physical, characterized by a decreased capacity for work and reduced efficiency to respond to stimuli.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.
Redness of the skin produced by congestion of the capillaries. This condition may result from a variety of disease processes.
Shedding of the outer layer of skin or mucosal tissue.
The part of the face that is below the eye and to the side of the nose and mouth.
A skin crease on each side of the face that runs from the outer corners of the nose to the corner of the mouth. It is a common site of PLASTIC SURGERY.
A lesion on the surface of the skin or a mucous surface, produced by the sloughing of inflammatory necrotic tissue.
The oval-shaped oral cavity located at the apex of the digestive tract and consisting of two parts: the vestibule and the oral cavity proper.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
